intro: Batrachium flaccidum, commonly known as the flaccid batrachium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
